profiles:
Experience Assistant Director, Donor Relations Santa Clara University September 2014  – Present (1 year) San Francisco Bay Area •	Responsible for the strategic development and evaluation of University giving societies including the President’s Club, Nobili Society, Founder’s Society, and the Thomas I. Bergin Legacy Society. Manage SCU giving societies to build donor engagement and loyalty. 
•	Develop, brand, and implement the new Loyal Bronco recognition program to recognize, engage and cultivate loyal donors to the University. 
•	Work collaboratively with the Donor Relations director and University events staff to execute annual donor cultivation and stewardship events. These events include the annual President’s Dinner, scholarship donor engagement, Reunion donor events, a donor holiday party, and tailored cultivation and stewardship events throughout the year. 
•	Manage naming opportunities and recognition across the university. 
 Distinguished Events Specialist American Cancer Society October 2013  –  September 2014  (1 year) Campbell, California • Manage annual Silicon Valley Invitational Golf Tournament and Silicon Valley Gala with a $400,000 fundraising portfolio.  
• Recruit and supervise high impact leadership volunteer committees, including managing major donor relationships, solicitation, and securing corporate underwriting. 
• Lead the planning process for distinguished events, including goal setting, budgeting, event logistics, volunteer committees, and evaluation. 
• Identify and cultivate relationships with targeted systems/organizations, including mobilization of a diverse population of community volunteers and major donors.  
• Collaborate with staff within the Corporate & Distinguished Partners team to leverage external affiliations and execute best practices that result in growth of event revenue in alignment with income plans. Senior Manager, Relay for Life American Cancer Society December 2012  –  October 2013  (11 months) campbell, ca • Recruited, cultivated, and empowered over 300 volunteers and 75 committee members for five Relay For Life events that have included over 1200 participants and raised over $350,000.  
• Achieved a bi-weekly 20% solicitation win ratio for recruiting teams, committee leadership and sponsorship. 
• Spearhead successful implementation of outbound marketing communications and emails to constituents to promote active engagement and solicit community support. 
• Train volunteer committees to ensure best practices and implementations of event model. 
• Facilitate speaking engagements and presentations educating various groups about the mission and opportunities for involvement with the American Cancer Society. Learning Coordinator Stanford University October 2010  –  December 2012  (2 years 3 months) • Manage coordination of learning programs (classes, retreats, conferences, etc.) including creating and maintaining calendar and registration, and logistics including materials, facilities, and travel. 
• Market and advertise department programs and resources, including writing the department’s quarterly newsletter, graphically designing and publishing all course materials, and maintaining the department website using Interwoven. 
• Develop, process, and maintain records of training files and data, rosters, evaluation reports including spreadsheets and databases using both standard and proprietary software. 
• Manage departmental financial processes including supply procurement, vendor payments, and budget planning and reconciliation for $300,000 departmental budget. 
• Primary contact for scheduling employee participation in learning programs. Undertook additional projects to support departmental and organizational objectives. Executive Assistant/Special Events Coordinator Opa! Authentic Greek Cuisine/Hero Builders June 2009  –  September 2010  (1 year 4 months) Los Gatos, CA • Executive assistant to an attorney who owns and operates a commercial construction company and a rapidly growing chain of restaurants. Assist owner in all capacities relating to company growth, including developing new locations and restructuring of company protocols. 
• Responsible for all book and record keeping for all Opa! Restaurants and Hero Builders. 
• Develop and implement marketing and branding strategies, web operations, and vendor selection and negotiation. 
• Work with clients to coordinate all aspects of corporate and private parties and events. Bay Area Assistant Field Marketing Manager Fuze Beverage July 2007  –  April 2008  (10 months) • Organize and implement marketing events at a wide array of venues. Work with various accounts to increase brand visibility and sales. 
• Manage a team of 10 promotional models and orchestrate their involvement in events. Talent Manager The Hive November 2006  –  July 2007  (9 months) • Organized and implemented various marketing events for four Brown-Foreman brands. 
• Recruited and managed a team of promotional talent. Center Manager Pacific Business Centers March 2004  –  September 2005  (1 year 7 months) • Provided comprehensive administrative support to over 30 companies. 
• Managed marketing, sales, and leasing for San Mateo location. Responsible for accounting, including client billing and employee payroll. 
• Supervised daily operations of the center, including maintaining and developing client relationships, employee scheduling, ordering supplies, and providing technical support. Assistant Director, Donor Relations Santa Clara University September 2014  – Present (1 year) San Francisco Bay Area •	Responsible for the strategic development and evaluation of University giving societies including the President’s Club, Nobili Society, Founder’s Society, and the Thomas I. Bergin Legacy Society. Manage SCU giving societies to build donor engagement and loyalty. 
•	Develop, brand, and implement the new Loyal Bronco recognition program to recognize, engage and cultivate loyal donors to the University. 
•	Work collaboratively with the Donor Relations director and University events staff to execute annual donor cultivation and stewardship events. These events include the annual President’s Dinner, scholarship donor engagement, Reunion donor events, a donor holiday party, and tailored cultivation and stewardship events throughout the year. 
•	Manage naming opportunities and recognition across the university.

Summary Professional, polished and amiable...with more than 15+ years of solid industry experience in a sales and administrative role. Experience Office of Development - Learning Coordinator Stanford University April 2013  – Present (2 years 5 months) Stanford, CA Executive Asst. to Chairman, John Hartnett & President, John Stanton Irish Innovation Center April 2012  –  April 2013  (1 year 1 month) San Jose, CA Executive Assistant SVG Partners April 2012  –  April 2013  (1 year 1 month) Silicon Valley, CA Staffing Manager/Account Executive Accountemps October 2011  –  April 2012  (7 months) San Jose, CA Accountemps places accounting and finance professionals on a temporary basis. We match highly skilled candidates with businesses requiring immediate, specialized assistance on a project basis and also provide individuals who can transition into full-time roles. This staffing model helps professionals further their careers and allows employers to access the professional they need, when they need it. Accountemps has more than 350 offices around the world.  
 
In 2011, our parent company, Robert Half International, again was named to FORTUNE® magazine’s “World’s Most Admired Companies” list, ranking #1 in our industry in service quality and innovation. (March 21, 2011) Account Executive Robert Half Technology November 2010  –  November 2011  (1 year 1 month) Specializing in the placement of highly skilled technology professionals on a contract, contract-to-hire, and permanent basis. I work with small, medium, and enterprise size companies to help with their staff augmentation in focus of Engineering of Application Development, Web Development and Business Systems. Regional Sales Representative Oakwood Worldwide April 2008  –  November 2010  (2 years 8 months) Responsible researching existing accounts, identifying opportunities for expanding service offerings. Develop sales strategy, including comparing, providing and evaluation of Oakwood’s services to make appropriate recommendations based on a client’s needs. Service a book of existing accounts in addition to acquring net new business. Self-generates prospects and cold leads. Maintaining an active sales pipeline to help continually close more opportunities. Account Coordinator Oakwood Worldwide April 2003  –  April 2008  (5 years 1 month) Responsible for building and maintaining relationships with clients to promote future business, with local apartment communities to obtain the best available rates and lease terms, and with the internal team and upper management to provide a smooth and consistent flow of information. Create opportunities from incoming calls; Research properties and new businesses; Give tours of properties; Negotiate pricing with clients; Create and maintain group mail and email accounts. Guest Services Representative Oakwood Worldwide May 2002  –  April 2003  (1 year) Responsible for providing customer service via email and phone to residents staying in furnished corporate apartments, and for maintaining good personal and working relationships with internal and external clients. Acted as a primary liaison to residents after move-in and handled all customer service related issues. 
Communicated daily with District Manager on any service recovery needs. Drive to properties to conduct business which included walking properties, meeting with vendors, making deliveries and signing leases. Summary An enthusiastic and passionate organizer who is constantly learning about nuanced and multifaceted social justice issues. Enjoys collaboratively exchanging ideas on educating and mobilizing ourselves and our communities. Receives and gives constructive feedback, fosters team appreciation, and values abundance, compassion, and interdependence. Experience Program Assistant API Equality – Northern California May 2014  – Present (1 year 4 months) San Francisco Bay Area • Constructed curriculum for the 5th and 6th Intern Cohort, including political education pieces and community organizing skills trainings 
• Facilitates workshops for the first API Queer Justice Leadership Exchange 
• Cultivates relationships between our organization and our community partners  
• Facilitates the experience of our volunteers and our allies as they build skills and attend events 
• Participates in and organizes community members to support campaigns focused on leadership development, oral histories, and grassroots fundraising 
• Manages social media presences and coordinates website Web Content Editor Asian Americans for Civil Rights and Equality (AACRE) May 2015  – Present (4 months) San Francisco Bay Area • Collaborates with AACRE Network Groups to write, edit, and publish content 
• Reviews AACRE Website to ensure artistic and aesthetic quality, as well as engaging pieces 
• Acts as a liaison between AACRE Network Groups and AACRE Leadership Team  
• Coordinates a web-based communications strategy to amplify content reach Community Engaged Learning Coordinator Stanford University Program in Comparative Studies in Race and Ethnicity November 2014  – Present (10 months) Stanford, California • Guides students' service-learning experience by facilitating values-based reflection activities 
• Connects academic texts and discussions with community organizations and social issues  
• Maintains mindful and reciprocal relationship between class participants and community partners Peer Mentor Stanford University Center for Comparative Studies in Race and Ethnicity March 2014  – Present (1 year 6 months) Stanford, California • Mentored students considering a major in Comparative Studies in Race and Ethnicity 
• Developed branding strategy for the growth of the department 
• Envisioned new ways for university classes to integrate with off-campus grassroots efforts Intern Asian Americans for Civil Rights and Equality (AACRE) September 2014  –  March 2015  (7 months) San Francisco Bay Area • Connects the 8 progressive Asian Pacific Islander organizations within the AACRE Network  
• Promotes events through effective use of social media, original graphic design, and personal outreach

• Learned concrete community organizing skills such as volunteer recruitment, fundraising, and outreach 
• Developed and facilitated the Communications Committee Research Assistant Stanford University September 2012  –  June 2013  (10 months) • Worked as a researcher for the Political Psychology Research Group
